laboratory_examinations.findings: No evidence of ischemia, masses, hemorrhage, or cranial-artery occlusion or stenosis.
12.7Ã—10^9 per liter (91% neutrophils, 6% lymphocytes, 2% monocytes, and 1% immature granulocytes).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Leukocytosis can occur in acute stroke but is also consistent with an inflammatory or infectious process.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Clear CSF with a white-cell count of 20 per cubic millimeter (85% neutrophils, 6% lymphocytes, 9% monocytes), red-cell count of 16 per cubic millimeter, glucose level of 68 mg/dL (3.8 mmol/L), protein level of 44 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Mild pleocytosis supports diagnosis of an infectious or inflammatory process.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Clear CSF with a white-cell count of 17 per cubic millimeter (70% lymphocytes), red-cell count of 303 per cubic millimeter, glucose level of 60 mg/dL (3.3 mmol/L), protein level of 102 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Predominance of lymphocytes indicates a shift from initial neutrophilic predominance.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Latex agglutination test for bacterial antigens
qPCR assay of CSF for HSV
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for HSV-1 and HSV-2, VZV, and enterovirus.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Negative again upon repeat testing after further CSF samples.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Lymphocytic inflammatory process with presence of HSV-infected cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Positive for HSV-1 after several negative PCR results.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Substantial extension of signal abnormality in the left temporal and frontal lobes, with mild local mass effect.
Further progression of signal abnormality, with mass effect on the lateral ventricle and 4 mm of midline shift.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued clinical deterioration despite initial treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduction in mass effect, but no change in temporal-lobe signal abnormality.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decrease in mass effect but ongoing signal abnormality observed.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Extensive necrosis of the left temporal lobe.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates long-term effects of the disease.
